Chemical.content:
Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: It was found that three drugs stimulating central NA receptors failed to affect the analgesic ED50 of all antinociceptive agents and they enhanced catalepsy induced by morphine and fentanyl .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| NA (Norepinephrine or Norepinephrine receptors) |
| Morphine |
| Fentanyl |

These are the valid chemical entities identified in the paragraph. The original paragraph mentions "central NA receptors," which refers to norepinephrine receptors located in the central nervous system. The paragraph also mentions "morphine" and "fentanyl" as specific drugs.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| Norepinephrine (NA) and Norepinephrine receptors |
| Morphine |
| Fentanyl |

The original paragraph mentions "central NA receptors," which refers to norepinephrine receptors. Although "NA" is not explicitly stated as a chemical entity, it is a chemical substance, specifically a neurotransmitter. Therefore, it is included in the table as "Norepinephrine (NA) and Norepinephrine receptors." The paragraph also mentions "morphine" and "fentanyl" as specific drugs, which are clearly chemical entities.
